meanings.sent3: The isotropic fabric made it easy to sew a perfectly fitting dress.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was isotropic, spreading warmth and care in every direction.
meanings.sent5: The isotropic glow of the sunset painted the sky in a symphony of colors.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting the same properties in all directions.
meanings.sent1: The crystal showed isotropic behavior, reflecting light uniformly from all angles.
meanings.sent2: The isotropic properties of the lens ensured clear vision from any viewpoint.
meanings.sent3: The isotropic behavior of the puppy's tail wagging excitedly amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His isotropic talent for storytelling captivated audiences in every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The isotropic growth of the plant's roots spread evenly in the soil, seeking nutrients.
